Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your reply Elaine, The drain they have fitted goes into my cut about 2cm wide, if i put a dressing on it doesnt even last half an hour, so while in the house i have a towel held in place by my old bra, Im hoping the flow will abate a bit by the end of the weekend, I have my 2 week follow up app on Monday with my surgeon so im hoping something else can be done, I dont have an infection as yet so fingers crossed. The bcn gave me a whole box of dressings so will try them out when i go out, its hard to keep it dry as its constantly leaking, I had a drain fitted after the node clearance and that was fine, easy to empty but now im emptying onto a towel and have a soggy armpit lol. thank you for your reassurance, it helps to know others are facing the same problems .
Posts.Title: burst seroma after full axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi all I am just asking if any of you ladies had any trouble with full node clearance. Had my op on sept 26th, all went well, had my drain out 2 days later. then i felt awful pressure around the wound site and knew it was a seroma, this was uncomfortable but not to bad, then a couple of days later my cut was seeping a bit so i covered it when i went out, then i was about to get in the bath and the seroma burst through my disolveable stitches, I rang the district nurse who advised me to see the breast nurse next day which i did, by this time serous fluid was pouring out of me & i had to have a folded towel under my arm as a dressing was out of the question. The breast nurse said there wasnt much i could do but wait till it abated, so i went home a bit soggy but ok. The next day my disolveable stitches had dissolved and i had a gaping hole about 3 inches long, I went back to the breast nurse today thinking they would stitch me back up. They told me that they couldnt stitch me up as i was losing too much fluid so they stitched me a drain in, i was told this would take weeks to heal and i would have to catch the fluid in a hand towel strapped to my waist. so i am sitting here really uncomfortable and have to hold a towel under me everywhere i go, has any of you ladies had anything like this ?? I now have my bra fastened round me without my boobs in the cups to hold the towel in place.. I really would be grateful if anyone has any better ideas i could try.

Posts.Title: Just had my first chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Jane, I was diagnosed in Feb, had a lumpectomy in March with 2 nodes removed, Cancer was in one node so after chemo I have to have full node clearance, then radiation. Just finished the FEC chemo, it wasnt as bad as I thought it was going to be.  I had some side efffects after 2 days, mainly indigestion, but got tablets off the doctors before next lot, I took the anti sickness tabs and had no problems, my mouth got sore after a few days so had more tablets for that and food tastes like plastic or cardboard !!! I managed to go to work the next day after treatment and found that keeping a positive attitude really helped. I didnt have the cold cap and my hair started to fall out 2 weeks after the first FEC. I got my daughter buzz it off with the dog clippers as i didnt want to sit in the hairdressers and have it done. we both laughed and cried, it was emotional but inevitable. I got a lovely wig fitted but only wear it on special occasions as its a bit itchy. I wear a cap now as i feel a bandana would advertise the fact that i have cancer !!! I have my next lot of chemo in 2 weeks which will be by drip infusion. there are a lot of lovely ladies on here who know what you are gong through and can help immensely. please let me know how you get on. Caryn xx
Posts.Title: Just had my first chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Like you my skin got terribly burnt and broke down underneath my breast after rads, I was using aqueous cream at first but it did not help with the insane itching !! I was given some pure Aloe Vera Gel from the complimentary therapist at the lymphodema clinic, this was so soothing and cool and really worked wonders, I now have Diprobase Cream in a big pump action bottle to put on my breast and arm, certainly worth a try, The pricking itching drove me mad for weeks. Posts.Content: Thank you ladies for your replies, My Hot Pink Doc Martins make people look at my feet and not my head !! My lady garden is growing back at an alarming rate unfortunately !!  I lost my hair and lashes & Eyebrows but i still had to shave the 3 hairs off my big toe !!! What was that all about  ?  just waiting for my node clearance wound to heal then i can start Rads, its a long road for us all but with each others support and friendship we can conquer just about anything love to you all xxxx
Posts.Title: going Commando !!!!!

Posts.Content: I have been wearing hats for months now & I am quite sick of them !! after finishing my chemo in August, my hair has just started growing back, I was getting fed up with my hats as they were itchy and i got hot in them, plus i had to restrict my head movement in them or they started to come askew ! I have around an inch of new baby down hair & have ditched the hat, people made me feel uncomfortable in my hat as they stared at me with pity all over their faces, so now i let them stare at my new fluffy very short hairdo and it doesnt bother me 1 bit anymore It would be nice if people could be a bit more considerate as we are going through hell without the worry of being noticable. I am hoping to have a short crew cut for christmas !! Also my eyelashes and eyebrows are coming back which i am so grateful for, I bought the new Benefit mascara, it was pricey at £18.50 but I cant believe how fantastic it is, my new stubby lashes look amazing without falsies, Its definatly worth the money love & Hugs to all you ladies xx
Posts.Title: going Commando !!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi. there, I have just finished treatment for breast cancer and booked a well deserved holiday, I used a company called Manor Insurance 0845 8501066, I am going to Menorca for only a week and they covered me for the breast cancer and my daughter for £54.00 in total, by far the cheapest quote i had, so its worth a try, I know Menorca is a far cry from the States but just thought you might like to try them I hope your mum has a wonderful trip and a well deserved break xx
Posts.Title: Travel insurance help please

Posts.Content: Hi Annie Im having my 3rd and last Fec Chemo on the 11th (Monday) I too was worried about it all, especially about my hair, It started to come out after the second week after having my 1st Fec,  i was straightening my fringe and it came out in the straighteners, I was upset but knew it would happen, I got my daughter to get the dog clippers out and give me a number 1 , I didnt want to sit at the hairdressers with other people seeing.  We made a laugh out of it even though it was tough, I have a great wig which I only wear for weddings, partyies etc as it is a bit itchy, I wear a cap when i go out, The Fec gave me bad indigestion which i had never had before so i got some tablets off the doctor and i didnt get it again, I didnt suffer sickness at all, and made sure i took my anti sickness tablets in case !!! the worse thing for me was the sore mouth and everything tasting of cardboard or plastic, I got mouthwash off the docs and it calmed down. Im sure you will be fine, keep a diary of your side effects so next time you are prepared and can sort it pout beforehand, let me know how you get on. much love to you Caryn xx
